info.label: Senior Developer
info.brief: Dale Karp is a web architect specializing in full stack development with JavaScript. Whether it's a small feature for a currently existing site or an entire applications with complex features, Dale makes use of modern best practices to deliver high-quality products to his clients.

projects.title: Mozilla Firefox - WebVTT
projects.summary: A W3C standard for displaying timed text with the <track> element.
highlights: Worked with a team of seven others to implement the WebVTT standard into the Mozilla Firefox browser
Wrote some of the C++ DOM implementation for the track element in Mozilla Firefox
Fixed some bugs in the Node-based WebVTT validator
Presented our work as a group live on [Air Mozilla](https://air.mozilla.org/webvtt-web-video-text-tracks/)

projects.title: Giffy
projects.summary: Created the backend and frontend for an online GIF uploading & creation web service.
highlights: Forked and added features to an open source Amazon S3 uploader to enable direct-to-S3 uploads from the browser
Implemented ability to create GIFs in the browser using a webcam and the WebRTC API

projects.title: Jump Around
projects.summary: A simple 2D platformer game in JavaScript using the Phaser game framework

highlights: Created a mobile-friendly web application for startup [**Kranium**](https://kraniumnetwork.com/), including a custom user messaging system
Implemented the client-side code for a shopping cart system for [**BBbarfly.com**](http://bbbarfly.com/)
Used designer-built wireframes to build pages for the Webmaker homepage leading up to and after its launch
Assisted in implementing features and fixing cross-browser bugs for the upcoming Webmaker Profiles application
Added new features and fixed existing bugs in a large codebase inherited by the project
Participated in code reviews and bug triages

history.employer: Centre for Development of Open Technology (CDOT)
highlights: Assisted in converting the Flash-based BigBlueButton online lecturing system client to HTML5
Fixed client side bugs in an application written with CoffeeScript, Node and Backbone.js
Supervised roll-out of Dunder Mifflin Infinity website.
Helped first and second year Computer Studies students understand programming concepts and syntax
Helped students become confident enough to solve problems on their own

history.summary: A multiline summary of the education.
Successfully completed four semesters in a **Philosophy / Political Science** Double Major BA

interests.name: reading
interests.summary: Jane is a fan of mystery novels and courtroom dramas including Agatha Christie and John Grisham.

interests.name: hiking
interests.summary: Jane enjoys hiking, light mountain climbing, and has four summits under her belt!
